org.jcvi.jillion.align

Interface SequenceAlignment<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - the Residue type.
    S - the Sequence type.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Hsp<R,S,B>, NucleotidePairwiseSequenceAlignment, NucleotideSequenceAlignment, PairwiseSequenceAlignment<R,S>, ProteinPairwiseSequenceAlignment, ProteinSequenceAlignment
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder.AbstractSequenceAlignmentImpl

    public interface SequenceAlignment<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,?>>
    SequenceAlignment is an interface that describes an alignment between two Sequences.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAlignmentLength()
      Get the length of the alignment including any gaps.
      S getGappedQueryAlignment()
      Get the Sequence that represents the gapped sequence of the query that aligns to the subject.
      S getGappedSubjectAlignment()
      Get the Sequence that represents the gapped sequence of the subject that aligns to the query.
      int getNumberOfGapOpenings()
      Get the number of times a consecutive group of gaps (which may only be of length 1) appears in the alignment.
      int getNumberOfMismatches()
      Get the number of residues that align but do not match.
      double getPercentIdentity()
      Get the percent of the residues that match exactly.
      DirectedRange getQueryRange()
      Get the DirectedRange that represents the portion of the full input query sequence that is used in this alignment.
      DirectedRange getSubjectRange()
      Get the DirectedRange that represents the portion of the full input subject sequence that is used in this alignment.

    • Method Detail

      • getPercentIdentity

        double getPercentIdentity()
        Get the percent of the residues that match exactly.
        Returns:
        the percentage as a double; this value will be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

      • getAlignmentLength

        int getAlignmentLength()
        Get the length of the alignment including any gaps.
        Returns:
        a positive integer.

      • getNumberOfMismatches

        int getNumberOfMismatches()
        Get the number of residues that align but do not match.
        Returns:
        a positive integer which may be 0.

      • getNumberOfGapOpenings

        int getNumberOfGapOpenings()
        Get the number of times a consecutive group of gaps (which may only be of length 1) appears in the alignment.

        For example if a nucleotide sequence alignment contains the gapped sequence : AC-GT-ACGT----AA there are 3 gap openings.

        Returns:
        a positive integer with may be 0.

      • getGappedQueryAlignment

        S getGappedQueryAlignment()
        Get the Sequence that represents the gapped sequence of the query that aligns to the subject.
        Returns:
        a Sequence which probably contains gaps; will never be null.

      • getGappedSubjectAlignment

        S getGappedSubjectAlignment()
        Get the Sequence that represents the gapped sequence of the subject that aligns to the query.
        Returns:
        a Sequence which probably contains gaps; will never be null.

      • getQueryRange

        DirectedRange getQueryRange()
        Get the DirectedRange that represents the portion of the full input query sequence that is used in this alignment.
        Returns:
        a DirectedRange; never null.

      • getSubjectRange

        DirectedRange getSubjectRange()
        Get the DirectedRange that represents the portion of the full input subject sequence that is used in this alignment.
        Returns:
        a DirectedRange; never null.
